country_overview.content: The Maldives, famous for its crystal-clear waters, luxurious resorts, and stunning coral reefs, is a tropical paradise in the Indian Ocean. It is a popular destination for honeymooners, divers, and beach lovers. The Maldives offers visa-on-arrival for most nationalities, making it an accessible destination for many travelers seeking a tropical escape.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa for the Maldives is issued on arrival and is typically valid for 30 days. It is suitable for leisure travelers, honeymooners, and those visiting for short stays.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Travelers must have a valid passport, proof of onward travel, and sufficient funds for their stay. There are no prior visa requirements for most nationalities, as the visa is issued upon arrival.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of onward travel (return flight ticket)
Proof of accommodation (hotel booking or resort reservation)
Sufficient funds for the duration of the stay

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: For most travelers, a Tourist Visa is issued upon arrival in the Maldives. Ensure that you meet the basic entry requirements.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Confirm that your nationality qualifies for visa-on-arrival and that you meet the entry requirements such as having a valid passport and proof of onward travel.

step_3.title: Prepare Required Documents
step_3.description: Ensure that you have all the required documents ready, including your passport, proof of accommodation, and return flight ticket.

step_4.title: Travel to Maldives
step_4.description: Upon arrival at the airport in the Maldives, proceed to the immigration counter with your documents for inspection.

step_5.title: Visa Issuance
step_5.description: Your Tourist Visa will be issued on arrival if you meet all the requirements. The visa will be stamped in your passport, allowing for a stay of up to 30 days.

visa_fees.content: There is no visa fee for the Tourist Visa issued on arrival in the Maldives. However, ensure that you meet all entry requirements.

processing_time.content: Visa-on-arrival is processed immediately upon arrival at the airport. No prior application is required.

visa_validity.content: The Tourist Visa issued on arrival is typically valid for up to 30 days. Extensions may be possible but require application to local immigration authorities.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival, travelers must present a valid passport, proof of onward travel, proof of accommodation, and sufficient funds. Ensure compliance with these requirements to avoid complications.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my Tourist Visa in the Maldives?
faq_1.answer: Extensions for Tourist Visas are possible but require application to the local immigration authorities. It is advisable to check the process and requirements in advance.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival for the Maldives?
faq_2.answer: For most nationalities, a Tourist Visa is issued upon arrival. However, travelers should confirm their specific requirements before traveling.

faq_3.question: Can I work in the Maldives on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is strictly prohibited. You must obtain a work visa if you plan to work in the Maldives.
